Kala Siswa SD Bingung Ditanya Sri Mulyani Siapa Nama Mendikbud
04 Nov 2019, 03:01 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati/Foto: Eduardo Simorangkir/detikcom

Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati pagi ini menjadi guru spesial di SDN 01 Kenari, Senen, Jakarta Pusat. Wanita kelahiran Lampung tersebut mendapat jadwal mengajar di kelas VI-A di hadapan 25 murid.Dalam kesempatan tersebut, Sri Mulyani melakukan tanya jawab dengan para murid mengenai Indonesia, mulai dari bentuk negara, tujuan negara, hingga komponen pelengkap negara seperti presiden, wakil presiden dan para menteri.Awalnya para siswa sangat lancar menjawab setiap pertanyaan dari Sri Mulyani. Namun ada peristiwa unik saat Sri Mulyani menanyakan nama menteri pendidikan ke para murid. Kompak, seluruh siswa-siswi diam saat ditanyakan mengenai pertanyaan tersebut."Ayo coba siapa yang tahu nama pendidikan kita sekarang siapa. Yang paling muda," kata Sri Mulyani.Para murid kembali diam dan saling bertanya ke temannya satu sama lain. Sri Mulyani kemudian memberi kisi-kisi jawaban pertanyaan tersebut dengan menanyakan pertanyaan lain."Kalian semua pernah naik Gojek nggak? Siapa yang punya ayo?" kata Sri Mulyani.Sontak para murid menyebut nama Nadiem Makarim. Tampaknya nama Nadiem Makarim lebih dikenal sebagai bos Gojek dibanding menteri di benak para murid kelas VI-A SDN 01 Kenari saat itu.Sri Mulyani kemudian meminta perwakilan para murid bermain peran menjadi para pelengkap negara. Ada yang menjadi Menteri Keuangan, Dirjen Pajak, Mendikbud, Kapolri, hingga Menteri Pertahanan. When Elementary School Students Confused Asked Sri Mulyani Who Is the Name of the Minister of Education and Culture
Nov 04 2019, 03:01 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati / Photo: Eduardo Simorangkir / detikcom

Jakarta - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati this morning became a special teacher at SDN 01 Kenari, Senen, Central Jakarta. The woman born in Lampung received a schedule of teaching in class VI-A in the presence of 25 students. On the occasion, Sri Mulyani held a question and answer session with students about Indonesia, ranging from the form of the state, the purpose of the country, to the complementary components of the country such as the president, vice president and the ministers. Initially the students were very fluent in answering every question from Sri Mulyani. But there was a unique incident when Sri Mulyani asked the name of the minister of education to the students. Compact, all students were silent when asked about the question. "Let's try who knows the name of our education now. The youngest one," said Sri Mulyani. The students returned to silence and asked each other their friends. Sri Mulyani then gave a lattice of answers to these questions by asking other questions. "Have you all ever taken a Gojek or not? Who has it?" said Sri Mulyani. Suddenly the students mentioned the name of Nadiem Makarim. It seems that Nadiem Makarim's name was better known as Gojek's boss than the minister in the minds of students of class VI-A SDN 01 Kenari at the time. Sri Mulyani then asked representatives of the students to play the role of being the state's complementaries. Some of them became the Minister of Finance, the Director General of Taxation, the Minister of Education and Culture, the National Police Chief, and the Minister of Defense.
